Reviews.Title: “Fors hotel is a mini paradise”
Reviews.Author: uyiekpen
Reviews.Content: I was overwhelmed by the warm reception I received from the staffs at the hotel, especially Mr Arif, he was so pleasant. Gettin to the room was a pleasant surprise. I loved everything about fors hotel, it felt like a new family to me. Would definately have a repeat stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust photos”
Reviews.Author: Michael U
Reviews.Content: very little rooms.we had a twin room.it was 2x2m!like a shoe box.All photos on the hotel website are virtual.very poor district.be careful on night passing.no good security.no taxi knows the location.Hotel alley is full of garbage.the walls are very tin & you hear everything from beside rooms.it was more than 70 EU in high season(September).

Reviews.Title: “Alhamdulillah! Great stay, highly recommend it! :)”
Reviews.Author: Oabgan
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time at Fors hotel! The staff were very friendly and cooperative, the rooms were all very clean and well kept, and the hotel itself is very close to popular sites, like the Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmed Mosque). Overall, Fors is a very cute little hotel with great services and I strongly recommend it to anyone staying in Istanbul. JAZAKALLAH! :)

Reviews.Title: “Promises a lot but does not deliever”
Reviews.Author: Chrisonderstall
Reviews.Content: If you visit the hotel's website you'd be quite suprised when you arrive at the hotel and realise those images are photoshopped! The views from the hotels website are impossible, my room looked straight into a wall. The hotel is also in a very suspect area that the police told me was dangerous. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “this is a horrible hotel and I was robbed there !”
Reviews.Author: vanessa058
Reviews.Content: The hotel is hard to find, the room is tiny and the worse thing is that I discovered that several items in my unlocked suitcase were missing when i get home. Do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: CricketGirlDarwin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location for walking to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Grand Bazaar and restaurants. The hotel has friendly staff, good size rooms, a basic rooftop balcony and breakfast provided in pleasant light basement. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeet1975
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a lovely place to rest your head 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque without being flat bang in tourist central, then the Fors Hotel is for you. The staff cannot do enough for you and will happily chat away with you for hours about their lovely country. Fors is a true 3 star, it gives you a decent bed for the night and the added bonus of a cracking breakfast. The rooms aren't huge, romantic or grand however they are cleaned daily (with change of sheets), have AC and good shower pressure (though the bathrooms are pretty small). When I travel hotels are purely to lay my head in a safe and clean environment and Fors fitted this perfectly. If staying there please visit the Hamman across the road (built in 1734) if your male - my husband had a 3 hour treat session for $40L (incl of massage) and wouldnt stop raving about it and this wasn't his first hamman in life. Unfortunately the female version was pants, it cost the same however the staff were rude and basically I washed, got a 5 min scrub, no massage and was told to go - start to finish less than 30mins. Pure rip off, pure dissappointment and if honest, was extremely gutted. If there wasn't so many other places I'd like to go, I'd return to Istanbul and definitely stay at the Fors. There's several supermarkets close by, a locals-only cluster of streets containing fantastic hip restaraunts and equally small cheap eateries. Pro's: Great value for money, friendly staff, fantastic location, rooftop terrace. Con's: room a little small, not for romantics.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: artur0671
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel , to be honest I was very nervous, especially if you travel with an 18 months child and not knowing what to expect. I must say I was very impressed with the staff and the management. They were all very helpful and willing to assist. special mention goes to Arif (the co owner) who made our stay even more confortable.The hotel is small but very comfortable and kept very clean, our room was cleaned every day, very quite at night, breakfast was lovely. This hotel it is situated very close to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace and other historical places and some very nice restaurants nearby too. if you are looking to go instanbul for a city break, definately worth looking at this hotel, good value for monies.I would definetly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeezeR35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fors Hotel recently. Hotel staff was so helpful and room was decent size with fab views of Istanbul and spotless. Price was fantastic too for this kind of hotel, breakfast and service is 10 out of 10. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lion201us
Reviews.Content: Small Hotel but Very Neat & Clean. Hotel Staff Very Soft Spoken & Helpful. Peaceful Place. Will definitely stay again if I visit this place. Very Gentle people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1985
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad about this hotel, I really find it difficult to believe that anyone would give it anything but five stars. It is not a luxury hotel, but instead is exactly what it proffers to be. It is a small hotel in a central part of Istanbul with friendly staff and a welcoming atmosphere. The rooms are clean and well kept, the beds comfortable and linen fresh. Even the small details are there, the fittings for the room are ornamental yet not gaudy and the bathrooms are bright and clean. Upon arrival we were greeted by the manager who provided us with plenty of information and leaflets about what to do while we were there and generally offered us a very warm welcome to his hotel and city. Eager to explore we asked for directions to the hippodrome. The only downside to this hotel is it is at the bottom of a hill, however, I think you will find that everything in Istanbul is on a hill. It is very very hilly. If you are disabled this may not be the best place for you to visit, as in general as we found accessibility lacking (although improving). The breakfast at the hotel is a continental breakfast and whilst simple is plentiful and well cooked and typical of this country. The staff are probably the friendliest I have ever met, and I have stayed in hotels more expensive than this one where you perhaps would expect to be paying for improved service. I arranged a pick up from Sabiha Gocken through Fors and this went without a hitch unlike my friends whose stay overlapped ours and went through their agent. I really can not rate this hotel highly enough, no it is not a luxury hotel and the price reflects this. However it is excellent value if you want somewhere you will be welcomed with open arms, and made to feel you never want to leave. Special thanks to Nufer whose welcome and genuine friendship made our stay all the better.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: ellynvb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fors hotel from 31 Oct 2010 to 6 Nov 2010. Our first room was extremely small, and we changed rooms to one on the second floor after a couple of days that was bigger. Both rooms were spotless clean, with all the amenities one might wish for: TV, mini bar, wireless internet. The hotel is located in the Sultanahmet district and was convenient to all the historical sights, the Grand Bazaar and the tram line. What made this hotel really special for us, was the staff. Everyone was really friendly and Areef (forgive my spelling) was outstandingly helpful in every way. He helped make this "a trip of a lifetime"

Reviews.Title: “New & very clean, but without car parking”
Reviews.Author: Claudiaal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK - new and realy clean but on the web sites they say that have free parking nearby. In fact the parking is on the small street in front of hotel - totaly unsafe. Like the hotel, the staff is at begining but friendly. The rooms and bathrooms are small, the view from the window is at ugly roofs. The hotel have a good location for the people that come with the plane and want a hotel in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lewiswensley
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the fors hotel for 5 days in august, and although i do not normally post on websites i felt that i must this time... the hotel and staff were brilliant throught out our stay,the rooms were clean and tidy.... and were very pleasent and tastefully decorated, the breakfast was very welcome to get us on our way.. beds were comfortable, and had no problems sleeping at all after our long tiering days exploring.... admitidly, we prob had the smallest room, but we were in istanbul, and we came to istanbul to see the sites and wouldnt be spending a lot of time in the hotel.. the rate s of the rooms are very resonable and great value compared to other hotels in the area.. it is in a quiet area just 10 mins walk from all major historical sites. 1 downside was that the hill it was on was quite an incline.... we had to go up this hill everyday to get to the sites, BUT i would say that unless you stayed on the main street (bars, restaurants, tram lines etc.)..... you had a hill to climb... either way... as we discovered that istanbul (sultanhamet) is a hilly area..... overall very good..... and when we visit again in the near future we wouldnt consider anywere else to saty..... regards jo and lewis

Reviews.Title: “excellent,clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: NOURFAMILY2010
Reviews.Content: we family of six stayed for 7 nights in fors hotel ,very pleasant ,clean hotel .The staff are very helpful especially YUNUS he is very friendly with smile all the time.the kids enjoyed the hotel and we all pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start - brilliant closure.”
Reviews.Author: ATahir
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my husband and 9 month baby and as a young and inexperienced mother I was terrified. My standards for hotel is quite high as I've only stayed in nothing less than at least 4 stars. But I was willing to give it a go on my husband's wish. The location is quiet hilly and I would not recommend it if you don't like to walk much, but then again all of Istanbul is hilly. We had no problems walking to SultanAhmet street. The rooms are always cleaned no matter what time you leave. The bathroom is tiny but exceptionally clean and that is definitely the most important part. It has a hair drier, but you might want to bring along your own toiletries. There is a small fridge and some snacks. Breakfast is in simple Turkish style but enough to get you started on your day, with bread, boiled eggs, fruit, yoghurt, warm bread, sausages...etc.. I happened to love it. The first night our AC did not function properly. We mentioned this to the hotel management on our way out the next day. When we arrived back they had changed our rooms and every single thing was in its right place as I'd left it. I was thrilled. Unfortunately the AC in that room was also not functioning but the fantastic staff and brilliant part owner Arif offered us yet another room. We finally settled in and after the first two days our stay at Fors Hotel was magnificent. I have to admit I have not met such accommodating and fantastic people as the staff and owners of this little hotel. They were so loving towards our son and we felt so welcomed by their heart-warming greetings. We had great chats with Zaynel Abedin, the second owner, and Arif. We would definitely go back when my kids are older as it was a bit difficult with baby. But if you stick to your routines everything will go well.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely new and is very close to all the attractions in the old part of Istanbul. The major problem with the hotel is the very steep stairs and the poor construction of it. If you are not very fit you will end up hurting yourself. The angle at which the stairs were constructed in makes it near impossible to climb up properly. Carrying luggage all the way up isn't pleasant either. I had booked a whole week in there and after the second night decided to go elsewhere. The beds weren't as comfy as I like them to be and the bathroom was tiny. There wasn't much space in the room to move around but that's something I can live with. Back to the location, it is just a few minutes walk from the major attractions BUT you will have to go climbing up a very steep hill for 10 minutes before you get to the main street. The breakfast was very good but given the problems we faced there I would not return back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: mgtraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with three others in early April. The hotel is brand new and absolutely immaculate. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms with two twin beds were sizable while rooms with one double bed are pretty small, but standard for this part of the city. The hotel is in a decent location, about 10 minutes walk or a quick cab ride from most major attractions. The road it is on is a bit steep but nothing to worry about. The hotel is in a busy area so it was hard to sleep at times due to street noise. I think if you bring earplugs that would solve the problem. The breakfast was lovely and we all had a great time. Istanbul is a magical city, and the people are great!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights - greedy part owner”
Reviews.Author: Dave877
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in March. Our initial impressions were very good, we were given room 201. This room is directly above the reception area and next to the steps. We did not get a good nights sleep during the stay, the night receptionist had the TV on all night and other guests arriving in late at night keep you awake coming up the marble stairs. Bedsheets were not changed the whole week of the stay, floor was not swept or mopped. When we booked via the Fors Hotel website we clicked on the link to give us a price in GBP (Â£) and printed this off. On the last night one of the 2 owners was on reception duty and insisted we had to pay the Euro price. We explained that we had printed the price in Â£ and would pay in Â£. The Euro price was Â£25 dearer. He basically said that we were lying, that you cannot gain a Â£ quotation off his site, even though we produced the printed quotation, annotated with website address and date of booking. Even after having shown him that you can gain a Â£ quotation, by logging on to his site he continued to argue ! After an hour of arguing he eventually phoned his partner who said that we were right and that we could pay in Â£. This particular partner we dealt with speaks little or no English. To cap it all, the transfer we had booked with the Hotel turned up 20mins late. Be prepared to spend an extortionate amount of money in Istanbul, it is twice the price of the south coast resorts. This cannot be classed as a Hotel, it only provides B&B.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean reasonably size hotel, had no problems at all.”
Reviews.Author: sads2010
Reviews.Content: nice and quiethotel, a bit of a challenge to get there, staff very friendly. i took my 4 year old son and my parents, they loved the placed. may be their good be some warm food for breakfast but apart from that excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean rooms, although a bit small, good breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jomahoes
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice rooms, although a bit small. Staff is very willing to help you. Well situated near hotspots like blue mosk and grand bazaar, shops and restaurants. Good breakfast and beds. Rooms are a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: mrsjTurkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December with my Boyfriend. Clean...friendly and great location. Would definatley stay here again and would highly recommend to anyone planning to stay in Istanbul! Ã§ok gÃ¼zel hotel! Mrs J UK

Reviews.Title: “Overall pleasant stay (5 nights)”
Reviews.Author: andreicer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the smallest (single?) room type. The purpose of my visit to Istanbul was sightseeing, so choice of hotel was based on proximity to the key sights in Sultanahmet and price. Overall hotel and rooms are clean. My room was on the smaller side - the bed takes up most of the room, but is large and could comfortably sleep two. As I only came in to sleep, size of the room did not matter to me. What mattered was that staff was extremely friendly and helpful (not just hotel-related, but helping find places, get info and get around). There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel. Nice Turkish style breakfast (although that may vary over time). There is a flatscreen satellite TV on the wall with channels in all possible languages (although no premium movie channels or even CNN), and mini-fridge with refreshments. There is a local Turkish bath down the street, and a couple of historical baths within 10 minutes walk. The hotel is in a residential part of Sultanahmet, so it's quiet, and there are a few grocery stores and restaurants nearby. As the description on the hotel's website suggests, it's close to everything if you can walk. Keep in mind the hills are pretty steep and streets are winding, so if you're geographically challenged, returning at night by foot might be an adventure. I felt safe roaming around the neighborhood at any hour. There is hardly anybody on the street after 10pm. I definitely recommend this hotel if what you are looking for is a clean, sensibly-priced hotel close to all major sites in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: johndegree
Reviews.Content: Hotel is hidden in SultanAhmet district, so be ready that taxi doesn't hit that from first shot. The hotel is new and, probably, that's why is cheap. We saw three types of rooms, small like wardrobe with window on the wall and really small bathroom, room with 3 beds nice and relatively spacey but with sounds from nearest mosques, and usual double room without major problems excepts poor isolation from inner hotel sounds. Breakfast defenetly is not worth to wake up because of that. But in general the hotel is pleasant and is located suitable.
